doc:
Pasquale Cajano https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pasquale_Cajano 0 Pasquale Cajano (born Pasquale Cagiano; August 19, 1921– October 24, 2000) was an Italian film actor. After two uncredited cameo appearances in The Age of Innocence and Where Evil Lies, his friend Martin Scorsese cast him in the 1995 crime drama Casino as Chicago Outfit boss Remo Gaggi, the film's de facto antagonist and inspired by the real-life Joseph Aiuppa. After Casino, Cajano went on with small roles in certain films, like Big Night, Sleepers, and The Impostors (another uncredited role). Cajano was then cast alongside his Casino co-star Robert De Niro in the hit comedy Analyze This. Pasquale Cajano was also a well known Italian radio personality for many years on the Italian Communications Network radio (www.icnradio.com). On October 24, 2000, Cajano died of prostate cancer at the age of 79. Pasquale_Cajano ( born Pasquale_Cagiano ; August_19_,_1921 – October_24_,_2000 ) was an_Italian_film_actor . After two_uncredited_cameo_appearances in The_Age of Innocence and Where Evil Lies , his_friend_Martin_Scorsese cast him in the_1995_crime_drama_Casino as Chicago_Outfit_boss_Remo_Gaggi , the_film 's_de_facto_antagonist and inspired by the_real-life_Joseph_Aiuppa . After Casino , Cajano went on with small_roles in certain_films , like Big_Night , Sleepers , and The_Impostors ( another_uncredited_role_) . Cajano was_then_cast alongside his_Casino_co-star_Robert_De_Niro in the_hit_comedy Analyze This . Pasquale_Cajano was also a_well_known_Italian_radio_personality for many_years on the_Italian_Communications_Network_radio_(_www.icnradio.com_) . On October_24_,_2000 , Cajano died of prostate_cancer at the_age of 79 .
